Case reference: 2006024599.CaseDesc: Chester Sawyers was last seen outside of a camp in Lochalsh (Riggs Township), Ontario on June 8, 1990.  It was reported that he was upset and indicated that he was heading home. It was believed that Mr. Sawyers left on foot and he has not been seen since.

Wallet: Brown, MasterCard, Canadian Tire Card, a driver's license

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2006016199.CaseDesc: Erich Striewski left Canada in his sailboat "Rochelle."  He was last seen in Aruba, stocking up with supplies. He left Aruba on February 12, 1992, and intended to sail to Panama. Neither Mr. Striewski or his boat have been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2014005236.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1973, Françoise Guilbault reportedly left her home in Joliette, Quebec. She left a note for her husband and took a bus to Montreal. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2011000499.CaseDesc: In August 1996, Bruce Berthelot left his family residence in Leamington, Ontario. M. Berthelot indicated that he was going away for a little while and asked his mother for $1000. He had been unemployed for several months and was dealing with some health issues. Prior to leaving he telephoned his friends in Manitoba a number of times. His family believes that he was headed to Western Canada. He has lived in Manitoba in the past. Mr. Berthelot is a skilled carpenter, and enjoys fishing and boating.  He has had no contact with any members of his family or friends since leaving.

Case reference: 2014005260.CaseDesc: On May 31, 2009, at approximately 6:00 p.m., Gordon Farrow was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Gordon advised that he was going to Sudbury, Ontario, but has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023009705.CaseDesc: Paul Davis was last seen on November 5, 2022 when he went swimming off of the shores of Saint John West near the Bay Ferry dock in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2013000070.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, Serge Jobin was seen for the last time in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. He may have taken a bus to New York City in the United States. Serge is hearing impaired and mute.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2014004551.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1984, Robert Plewes was last seen at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. His truck was found six days later near Algonquin Park located in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004179.CaseDesc: On March 15, 1989, Leona Brule was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. During the time of her disappearance, Leona was leading a high-risk, and transient lifestyle. She may have spent sometime in Edmonton, Alberta and Florida, USA.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 7 teeth treated, 5 absent.

Case reference: 2014003815.CaseDesc: Monica Cardinal was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in February, 1997. Monica was last seen leaving a downtown hotel with an unknown male in June, 1993.

Case reference: 2012020011.CaseDesc: Daniel Richard McCallum was living in the Lillooet, BC area up until October 2008.  When his family hadn't heard from him for some time, they reported him missing. There are unconfirmed reports that he may have moved away, but police have been unable to determine his whereabouts. His disappearance is considered suspicious.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, scorpio sign with "Dan" written inside

Case reference: 2017061282.CaseDesc: On March 23, 1999, Andrew Fraser was seen for the last time near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022065035.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2022, Alex Lawson was last seen on foot, leaving his Madeline Street apartment in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Family have not heard from Alex since he was reported missing and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Blue, WINTER, Two tone puffy northface jacket
Scar: Abdomen, 8" wide from lower chest to pubic hair

Case reference: 2014004399.CaseDesc: On November 23rd, 2003 Donna Bakker was last observed leaving her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. The following day, her vehicle was located abandoned in Niagara Falls, New York.  Donna's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2006022399.CaseDesc: Jocelyn "Josh" Blais was last seen in a bait shop in Ignace, Ontario. He and a friend were headed to Cecil Lake (24 kilometres north of Ignace and 1 kilometre east off Hwy. 599) for a day of fishing. His overturned boat was later discovered.

Case reference: 2014001487.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Raymond Snakeskin was last seen in Wollaston Lake, Saskatchewan. He had told another individual that he was making a pilgrimage to Zangeza Bay on Reindeer Lake, Saskatchewan, approximately 60 kilometers through the bush. Raymond has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2014004850.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2006, Mario Julien was seen for the last time when he left his home aboard a taxi. The taxi transported him just to the roundabout in the Québec Bridge, in Quebec City, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006767.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2014, Guo Ding was seen for the last time when he was discharged from the Mount Sinai Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2018000902.CaseDesc: Daniel Harvey was seen for the last time on December 28, 2017 in the Bellerive district of Montreal, Quebec. None of Daniel's personal items were missing from his apartment.

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014000022.CaseDesc: Cynthia Albena Audy was last seen getting into a vehicle in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba on October 28th, 2004.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart and cross

Case reference: 2014003314.CaseDesc: Dorothy Spence was last seen panhandling near a bridge in downtown Vancouver by a family member on or about August 17, 1995. Ms. Spence was of no fixed address and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Foul play has not been ruled out in Ms. Spence's disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal. Mr. Bourgeault left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Mr. Bourgeault was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2006017899.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1973, John Begolo was last seen in Eganville, Ontario.  John indicated that he was planning to return to St. Catherine's, Ontario, by bus.  John has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Canadian Flag and Maple Leaf
Left Forearm, Nude woman entwined by snake

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2014005592.CaseDesc: The Timmins Police Service is actively investigating a historical missing person case involving the disappearance of William “Billy” Chookomolin. Mr. Chookomolin went missing from Timmins in the spring of 1995 at the age of 47.

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2023002821.CaseDesc: On January 17 2023, Diego Sarria Franco left his residence in Ottawa, Ontario in his 2018 Volkswagon Atlas and did not return home.  Diego's vehicle was located unoccupied in the area of Maple Avenue North in Pembroke Ontario on January 30.

Sweater: Black, HOODIE, Canada Niagara Falls written on the front

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen September 16, 1987, at the Petro Canada Gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October of 1987. It is believed that Mrs. Kreiser could be in Vancouver, BC area.

Case reference: 2016018567.CaseDesc: Mekayla was last seen at the STC Bus Depot in Yorkton at 1:45 p.m. on April 12, 2016. She went to school in the morning, but left shortly after arriving. She went to several businesses in Yorkton throughout the morning, then returned to school around noon. She bought lunch at the restaurant in the bus depot, but did not get on a bus that day. Mekayla left the bus depot in the early afternoon and hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2013000129.CaseDesc: Immaculate Basil was last seen June 14, 2013 on a road in a remote area north of Fort St James, BC.

Case reference: 2014002565.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1975, Carl Gallen was employed as an iron worker on the Long Spruce dam project. He was working with his partner on a cement wall near the river. Mr. Gallen was drilling into the wall when he fell into the water. His partner indicated that Carl went directly under the water and that he did not see him surface. Mr. Gallen was not wearing either a safety belt or life jacket. It is presumed Mr. Gallen drowned.

Case reference: 2012020045.CaseDesc: The RCMP is seeking assistance in locating Shirley Ann WAQUAN. She was last seen on July 1, 2007 in Fort McMurray.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2008005898.CaseDesc: On May 21st, 1991, Paul Tenke was seen for the last time on a red Norco mountain bike leaving his family home in St Catharines, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Paul was suffering from mental health issues.

Scar: Head, on the face from recent accident

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2013000115.CaseDesc: Gaby Luonga Kombe was last seen on August 23, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec. He had to go to Pie-IX metro station to meet a friend. Later in the evening, he called his son to tell him he was heading home. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2014041668.CaseDesc: Lise Fredette was last seen leaving work in the city of Peterborough on the evening of November 12, 2014. Subsequent investigation has led to the arrest and conviction of a male in regards to the disappearance of Mrs. Fredette, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004965.CaseDesc: Cecilia Nikal arrived in Vancouver to visit her mother on August 1, 1989; she then left her mother's house to live on the streets. She was last seen by her mother in October of 1989. A report by a family member that Ms. Nikal had subsequently moved to Vancouver Island was never confirmed.

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2014003539.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2001, Jeffery McArthur was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. It is important to note that Jeffery suffers from a medical condition that affects his coordination, and balance. During the time of his disappearance, he may have been driving a 1993 white Mercury Topaz. The vehicle was subsequently located on September 2, 2001, in the west parking lot of Rundle Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014004809.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Peterson was reported missing on August 7, 2006, by a family member.  Investigators were advised that Mr. Peterson's vehicle was not taken and that he does not have a history of leaving without first communicating with them. It was later determined that Mr. Peterson was last seen by a neighbor, close to his residence in Manitou, Manitoba, on the afternoon of August 5, 2006.  Numerous searches were conducted of Manitou and the surrounding area, none of which were successful.

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 2022006110.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2022, Steven Pinch was last seen in downtown area of Calgary, AB.  Steven is known to frequent the city of Red Deer, Alberta, and the town of Rocky Mountain House, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002041.CaseDesc: Sometime over the night of November 19 to 20, 1999, Mathieu Parent was seen for the last time leaving the Dagobert night club in Quebec, Quebec. His family has not heard from him since.

Pants: Nylon, Dark Blue, With white lines on the sides
Shoes: Blue, Yellow, With fluorescent yellow lines
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, Fubu, Long sleeves

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2022059311.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2017, the remains of an adult male between the ages of 40 and 60 were recovered from Lake Ontario in the area of Youngstown, New York, in the United States.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2020017914.CaseDesc: In January of 1983, Helen King was seen for the last time at the Woodbine Community Centre in Toronto, Ontario where she had been a volunteer. Helen is known for living a transient lifestyle and has had no contact with family or friends since this time.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue

Case reference: 2014002848.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Daniel McKenzie was seen for the last time. Daniel was reported missing after he was seen leaving a taxi, and running into the wilderness along the Quebec and Labrador border.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large
Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2014001622.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 1982, Clayton Mark Bussiere was last seen while driving his taxi cab on Lougheed Highway (Highway 7) in Mission, British Columbia. Mr. Bussiere's taxi cab, a 1978 blue Pontiac Lemans, has never been located. It is unclear as to whether or not Mr. Bussiere had a passenger at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Saint Christopher Medal necklace
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace up shoes; brand: Downunders
Sweater: Grey, Zippered Cardigan with Elbow Patches

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006285.CaseDesc: Philippe Guerin was reported missing from the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital on June 12, 1966. He is paralyzed on the left side as a result of having Polio at 10 years of age. He is missing his upper teeth.

Case reference: 2013000077.CaseDesc: On October 10, 1986, Michael Semergian was seen for the last time in the Outremont District in Montreal, Quebec. Michael has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes
Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2006027099.CaseDesc: Mr. Deorksen and two acquaintances were travelling on Kioshkokwi lake, Pentland Township, Kiosk, Ontario, in a canoe when it capsized. The two acquaintances were located deceased, but Mr. Deorksen has never been found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2013000005.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2009, Jody Hockett was reported missing to the Grande Prairie RCMP. Jody had been partying at a friend's apartment on February 22, 2009. She left the party and was expected to return.  She was last seen getting into an older, white car in the downtown area of Grande Prairie sometime later that night, or the early morning hours of February 23, 2009. Jody was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Buttocks, Heart Symbol on left side

Case reference: 2022052659.CaseDesc: On October 16, 2022, Bradley Kiefer was seen for the last time by his family in Medicine Hat, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, all of Bradley’s personal belongings, and vehicle were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.
